thread.title: Saints assistant coach Joe Vitt injured chasing car burglars
thread.title_full: Saints assistant coach Joe Vitt injured chasing car burglars - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: Saints assistant coach Joe Vitt injured chasing car burglars
text:
METAIRIE, LA (WVUE) - Saints assistant coach Joe Vitt was hospitalized after chasing two people who were breaking into his neighbor's car in Old Metairie, according to a spokesperson with the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office.
Officers say Vitt, 61, was at his Old Metairie home on Sunday at 3:50 a.m. when he noticed someone in his yard. He went outside when he saw a woman trying to enter his neighbor's car.
Vitt also noticed a man inside his car. The two perpetrators ran when they saw Vitt, according to the sheriff's office. Vitt chased them until he fell to the ground.
He suffered a broken wrist and ankle injury, according to a report from the Canal Street Chronicles.
Apparently Joe Vitt broke his wrist and tore his Achilles chasing a car burglar down the street in the middle of the night.
— Canal St. Chronicles (@SaintsCSC) October 20, 2015 Vitt was back at work the next day.
On Joe Vitt story, I'm told he was at work the next day.
— Sean Fazende (@SeanFazende) October 20, 2015 Vitt has been an assistant with the Saints since 2006. He served as interim head coach for 10 games in 2012, following the bounty scandal.
Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call Crimestoppers at 504.822.1111 or the Sheriff’s Office burglary division at 504.364.5300.
Copyright 2015 WVUE .
